posts.name: Tori Dell
posts.cooked:
I’m having some issues with Elastic using way too much memory. I don’t have an exact number right now, but if I remember correctly it has been somewhere around 2-4GB, which has been massively slowing down my laptop which is already running VSCode, DriverStation, and AdvantageScope. This isn’t normal, right? Could this be an issue with code, or is it on Elastic’s end? I’m not quite sure when it all started so its hard to identify anything I might have added to the dashboard that could be causing this.

I plan on doing a fresh install when I get the chance, but I was wondering if anyone has encountered the same issue and found any solutions.

posts.name: Ben Malito
posts.cooked: I had the same problem but I wasn’t sure if it was elastic or advantagescope using so much memory/cpu. Sometimes when I have elastic, advantagescope, and vscode open at once, one of them crashes.

posts.name: Tori Dell
posts.cooked: It’s definitely Elastic in this instance because the issues fix themselves as soon as I close Elastic, but not if I close the other programs. It has also caused vscode and AdvantageScope to crash.

posts.name: Sam
posts.cooked:
Would you be able to open a ticket on the (elastic GitHub)[ GitHub - Gold872/elastic-dashboard: A simple and modern dashboard for FRC ] with some more information?

Edit: I’m on mobile, so giving up on formatting that.

link_counts.title: GitHub - Gold872/elastic-dashboard: A simple and modern dashboard for FRC

posts.name: Tori Dell
posts.cooked: I’m quite busy right now and don’t have access to the robot to reproduce the issue (I think it doesn’t come up in simulation, but I’m not totally sure on that), but I will totally create a ticket when I get the chance.

posts.name: Nadav
posts.cooked:
This is a very concerning issue, in order to look into this, there’s some more information I would need:

Exactly how much memory was it using?

Which version of Elastic are you running?

Did this happen while connected to the robot or were you disconnected the whole time?

What widgets did you have open? (Field images tend to take up a lot of memory)

In addition, if you can send your log and configuration file, it might be helpful. Both of these can be found in the directory: %appdata%/com.gold872/elastic_dashboard

posts.name: Ben Malito
posts.cooked: I can’t say just how much memory it was using, but the laptop I was using had elastic open with two camera streams (15 fps) plus advantage scope and vs code. next time I work on our robot I’ll note some specs
